results.purpose: Track and manage trial box subscription resets for TPT (The Pets Table) customers in Kenya (KN) who experienced payment failures or cancellations, ensuring trial pricing is honored and managing subscription lifecycle
key_data_points: Country code: KN (Kenya)
Trial box SKU pattern: KN-T%
Cancellation threshold: 5+ canceled orders
Reset timeframe: 4 weeks maximum before subscription cancellation
Current tracking week: 2025-W48
Delivery date cutoff: 2025-11-25
Order statuses tracked: 'canceled', 'clarify_payment_error'
Product type: mealbox
Customer loyalty level: 0 (new customers)

entities.name: TPT (The Pets Table)
entities.context: Pet food subscription service offering trial boxes to new customers

entities.name: New Ventures Tech team
entities.context: Team responsible for manually resetting subscriptions back to trial SKU

entities.name: Databricks
entities.context: Database platform where queries are executed

entities.name: BOB (Back Office Backend)
entities.context: Tool used for bulk subscription cancellations and management

entities.name: #squad-nv-pet-food
entities.context: Slack channel for coordinating with engineers on subscription reset tasks

insights: Process runs on a bi-weekly schedule: Tuesdays (covering Sat-Tue deliveries) and Fridays (covering Wed-Fri deliveries)
Two-tier action system: subscriptions with 5+ canceled orders are permanently canceled, while those with fewer failures are reset to trial status
Manual intervention required from engineering team to reset trial subscriptions, indicating no automated solution exists
Payment failures are the primary reason for trial box cancellations, requiring CC (credit card) issue resolution
4-week grace period implemented to balance customer retention with operational efficiency
Process specifically targets unshipped boxes with dunning decision set to 'cancel' to prevent revenue loss
Trial boxes are smaller and lower-priced than regular boxes, making proper SKU management critical for pricing accuracy
Workflow involves cross-functional coordination between operations, customer care (CC), and engineering teams

results.doc_title: Research Roadmap & Project Tracking (GCI + IXI + USCI + GCX)
results.purpose: Tracks research projects and strategic initiatives across multiple HelloFresh Group brands (HelloFresh, Green Chef, Factor_) in various global markets
key_data_points: 22 total projects tracked
4 project statuses: Complete (7), In Flight (1), Planned (11), Deprioritized (2), Requested (1)
6 strategic anchors: Foundational Insights, Cultural Relevance, Value Perception, Consumer Closeness, Menu Expansion
Primary markets: United States, Global, Canada, Netherlands, Sweden
4 team flags: GCI-led (13), USCI-led (8), IXI-led (2), Prod Analytics-led (1)
Project timeline spans: Sep 2025 - Q2 2026

entities.name: HelloFresh
entities.context: Primary brand with most projects (16)

entities.name: Factor_
entities.context: Health-focused meal brand with 7 projects

entities.name: Green Chef
entities.context: Organic meal kit brand with 3 projects

entities.name: Joanna Lindenberg
entities.context: Most frequent approver (10 projects)

entities.name: Patrick Roney
entities.context: Approver for USCI-led projects (7 projects)

entities.name: Anne Laesecke
entities.context: Driver for most USCI-led projects (6 projects)

entities.name: Bassem Elhelaly
entities.context: Driver for GCI-led projects (5 projects)

entities.name: Dan-Octavian Balica
entities.context: Driver for global value perception studies

entities.name: GCI
entities.context: Global Consumer Insights team leading 13 projects

entities.name: USCI
entities.context: US Consumer Insights team leading 8 projects

entities.name: IXI
entities.context: Innovation/Experience Insights team leading 2 projects

insights: Value Perception (#1) is the most common strategic anchor with 8 projects, indicating a major focus on demonstrating customer value
Menu Expansion (#2) has 5 projects, primarily for Factor_ brand, suggesting product line diversification strategy
Health-related research is prominent: health claims validation, behavioral outcomes, 'food as medicine', and athlete nutrition
Only 32% of projects are complete (7/22), with 50% still in planning phase, indicating early-stage roadmap
US market has the most dedicated projects, but 'Global' scope appears frequently, showing international expansion focus
GCI team leads the majority of projects (59%), suggesting centralized research coordination
Two projects deprioritized: 'Efficient Inspired: Need Gap Analysis' and 'Green Box Survey Template'
Influencer Marketplace project is the only 'In Flight' initiative, representing a significant strategic bet on creator economy
Customer loyalty and retention are emerging concerns with multiple projects on 'super loyal customers' and cancellation reasons
GCS (likely Global Customer Satisfaction) has regular quarterly reporting cadence, showing established measurement practices

results.purpose: Tracks marketing test campaigns and A/B tests for Good Chop across different channels (SEM, Facebook, CRM, Direct Mail) with various promotional offers and pricing structures
key_data_points: Campaign naming convention: [Quarter] [Channel] [Offer Description]
Common pricing structures: $100, $110, $120, $140, $150
Popular offers: Welcome Kit, Free Ground Beef, Ribeyes, Choose Your Offer
Test periods: Q1-Q3 2023 and Q2-Q3 2025
Geographic variants: Standard US and Canada (CA) specific tests

entities.name: kelly.abrams@goodchop.com
entities.context: Owner of SEM (Search Engine Marketing) campaign tests for both New Business (NB), Competitor (Comp), and Brand channels

entities.name: yukie.yamamoto@goodchop.com
entities.context: Owner of Facebook (FB) advertising campaign tests

entities.name: yt@hellofresh.com
entities.context: Owner of CRM and Direct Mail (DM) campaign tests; appears to be from HelloFresh organization suggesting corporate relationship

entities.name: Good Chop
entities.context: Meat delivery/subscription service running promotional tests across multiple marketing channels

entities.name: HelloFresh
entities.context: Parent or partner company, indicated by email domain of one test owner

insights: Good Chop runs systematic A/B tests comparing different promotional offers, indicated by '__' separator in file names showing variant A vs variant B
SEM campaigns are segmented by audience type: New Business (NB), Competitor (Comp), and Brand
Facebook appears to be the most heavily tested channel with the most test variations
Pricing structures follow a pattern of multi-box discounts (e.g., 50-30-20 likely means $50 off box 1, $30 off box 2, $20 off box 3)
Product-focused offers (Ground Beef, Ribeyes, Welcome Kits) are tested against dollar-amount discounts
Tests span from 2023 to 2025, with most recent activity in Q2-Q3 2025
Canada market (CA) receives separate test variants, suggesting international operations
Some tests include '[3]' notation indicating three-way tests rather than standard A/B tests
One test references 'Tariff-Proof Copy' suggesting response to economic/trade conditions
FL notation appears frequently, likely meaning 'First Life' or 'For Life' promotional offers

results.doc_title: Research Roadmap & Project Tracking (GCI + IXI + USCI + GCX)
results.purpose: Tracks research projects and initiatives across multiple HelloFresh Group brands (HelloFresh, Factor, Green Chef) with strategic priorities, timelines, ownership, and status
key_data_points: 21 total projects tracked
Status distribution: 4 Complete, 3 In Flight, 9 Planned, 1 Requested
Team distribution: GCI-led (majority), USCI-led (6 projects), IXI-led (2 projects)
Geographic scope: Global, US, Canada, Sweden
Strategic anchors: Foundational Insights, Cultural Relevance, Value Perception, Menu Expansion, Consumer Closeness, Research Consulting
Timeline range: Completed projects from Q1 2025, planned projects extending to Q2 2026

entities.name: HelloFresh
entities.context: Primary brand with most projects (13 projects)

entities.name: Factor_
entities.context: Secondary brand focused on meal preferences and menu expansion (6 projects)

entities.name: Green Chef
entities.context: Brand with loyalty deep dive project (2 projects)

entities.name: Anne Laesecke
entities.context: Driver for 6 USCI-led projects, primarily Factor-related

entities.name: Bassem Elhelaly
entities.context: Driver for 5 GCI-led projects including GCS reporting and customer research

entities.name: Joanna Lindenberg
entities.context: Approver for multiple projects across brands

entities.name: Patrick Roney
entities.context: Approver for USCI-led projects

entities.name: Dan-Octavian Balica
entities.context: Driver for PR campaign and approver for brand equity research

entities.name: GCI
entities.context: Global Consumer Insights team leading majority of projects

entities.name: USCI
entities.context: US Consumer Insights team focusing on Factor and menu research

entities.name: IXI
entities.context: Innovation/Experience Insights team working on influencer marketplace

insights: Strong focus on menu expansion and product development, particularly for Factor brand with 4 planned projects in Q1-Q2 2026
Foundational insights category dominates with 9 projects, indicating emphasis on building core customer understanding
GCI team leads most initiatives (13 projects), suggesting centralized research function with global scope
Multiple completed quarterly GCS (likely Global Customer Satisfaction) reporting cycles showing established tracking rhythm
Strategic shift toward health/wellness themes: 'Eat Like an Athlete', 'longevity', 'food as medicine' concepts for Factor
Innovation focus on marketplace model with 'Influencer Marketplace' project described as 'Shopify for Food'
Geographic concentration in US market with some global initiatives; limited international market-specific research
Several projects lack complete metadata (missing dates, approvers), suggesting ongoing planning or data entry gaps
Cross-functional collaboration evident with multiple consulted/informed stakeholders per project
2026 planning emphasis with multiple projects focused on annual objectives, brand equity, and trend forecasting

results.purpose: Tracks marketing test campaigns and A/B tests across different channels (SEM, Facebook, CRM, Direct Mail) for Good Chop's promotional offers
key_data_points: Campaign naming convention: Quarter [Channel] Offer A __ Offer B
Promotional items: Ground Beef, Ribeyes, Wings, Welcome Kits A & B
Free item offers (FL = First Life/Limited?)
Test periods: 2023 Q1-Q2, 2025 Q2-Q3

entities.name: kelly.abrams@goodchop.com
entities.context: Owner of SEM (Search Engine Marketing) campaign tests - both New Business (NB), Competitor (Comp), and Brand campaigns

entities.name: yukie.yamamoto@goodchop.com
entities.context: Owner of Facebook (FB) advertising campaign tests

entities.name: yt@hellofresh.com
entities.context: Owner of CRM, Direct Mail (DM), and Canada (CA) campaign tests; appears to be from parent/partner company HelloFresh

entities.name: Good Chop
entities.context: Meat subscription/delivery service running promotional test campaigns

entities.name: HelloFresh
entities.context: Parent or partner company, indicated by email domain of one test owner

insights: Good Chop runs systematic A/B tests comparing different promotional offers across multiple marketing channels
Tests are organized by quarter and channel (SEM, FB, CRM, DM)
SEM campaigns are segmented by audience type: New Business (NB), Competitor (Comp), and Brand
Most recent tests (25Q3) focus on $100-$120 offers with payment plans, while older tests (23Q1) tested higher values up to $150
Facebook campaigns heavily test 'Welcome Kit' variations and free protein offers
Payment plan structures typically spread discounts across 3-4 orders (e.g., 50-30-20 means $50 off first, $30 off second, $20 off third)
There's a connection to HelloFresh infrastructure/team, suggesting Good Chop may be a HelloFresh brand or partnership
Tests include geographic variations (Canada-specific CRM tests marked as CRM-CA)
One test references 'Tariff-Proof Copy' suggesting response to economic/trade conditions
Most files were recently modified (June-July 2025), indicating active ongoing testing program

results.doc_title: Research Roadmap & Project Tracking (GCI + IXI + USCI + GCX)
results.purpose: Tracks research projects and initiatives across multiple brands (HelloFresh, EveryPlate, Factor, YouFoodz) aligned with strategic anchors, including project status, ownership, timelines, and stakeholder involvement
key_data_points: Project statuses: 1. Requested, 3. In Flight, Blocked, Deprioritized
Team flags: IXI-led, GCI-led, USCI-led, GCX-led
Strategic anchors: #1 Value Perception, #2 Menu Expansion, #4 Revamp App Experience, #5 Efficiency, Foundational Insights
Markets: Global, United States (US), Canada (CA), Australia (AU), Netherlands (NL), France (FR), Great Britain (GB)
Brands: HelloFresh, EveryPlate, Factor, YouFoodz, All brands

entities.name: HelloFresh
entities.context: Primary brand with most projects across app experience, customer onboarding, and meal planning

entities.name: Marc
entities.context: Approver for multiple IXI-led projects including Ignite meal planning and onboarding initiatives

entities.name: Joanna Lindenberg
entities.context: Approver for GCI-led projects and consulted on foundational insights

entities.name: Dan-Octavian Balica
entities.context: Approver for multiple GCI-led projects including typing tools and customer trackers

entities.name: Lexy Martin
entities.context: Driver for Ignite meal planning projects in US market

entities.name: IXI
entities.context: Leading team for app experience, customer journey, and interaction design projects

entities.name: GCI
entities.context: Leading team for brand tracking, customer segmentation, and foundational research

entities.name: USCI
entities.context: Leading team for market reference and foundational knowledge

entities.name: Ignite
entities.context: Meal planning initiative for HelloFresh US market

entities.name: Factor
entities.context: Brand undergoing global positioning work across multiple markets

entities.name: EveryPlate
entities.context: Brand with customer tracking initiatives in Australia

entities.name: YouFoodz
entities.context: Australian brand tracking time-strapped jugglers segment

insights: Majority of projects are in 'Requested' status, indicating a large pipeline of planned research initiatives
IXI-led projects dominate the roadmap, focusing heavily on app experience and customer journey improvements
Strategic anchor #4 (Revamp App Experience) has the highest concentration of projects, particularly for HelloFresh
Several projects are 'Blocked', suggesting resource constraints or dependencies preventing progress
Global scope is most common, but US market has significant dedicated research projects
Cross-selling, customer onboarding, and value perception are recurring themes across multiple strategic anchors
Early customer experience (first 8 weeks) is a key focus area with multiple related projects
Foundational Insights category contains many exploratory projects around customer understanding and competitive analysis
Limited completion dates are specified, with most projects still in planning or early execution phases
Strong emphasis on customer segmentation and personalization across the funnel
